docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Nov. 24 -- Satisfaction and confidence were expressed in Brazil tonight after it had been announced that at 1:15 o'clock this afternoon United States troops had hoisted their flag in Surinam, Netherland colony to the north,...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Nov. 24 -- Satisfaction and confidence were expressed in Brazil tonight after it had been announced that at 1:15 o'clock this afternoon United States troops had hoisted their flag in Surinam, Netherland colony to the north, and that simultaneously and by agreement Brazilian troops had reinforced the garrisons on the southern boundary of the colony.

headline.main: BRAZIL PLEASED BY SURINAM STEP; Sees Danger Point Converted Into Element of Strength in Hemisphere Defense

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 -- President Roosevelt sent to the Senate today the nomination of George S. Messersmith to be Ambassador to Mexico. The career diplomat will succeed Josephus Daniels, who has asked to be relieved.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 -- President Roosevelt sent to the Senate today the nomination of George S. Messersmith to be Ambassador to Mexico. The career diplomat will succeed Josephus Daniels, who has asked to be relieved.

headline.main: Career Diplomat, Now in Cuba, Is Experienced in Problems of Latin Nations and Europe -- His Confirmation Expected

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: SLOWLY but surely the Pan-American Highway -- perhaps the greatest road ever projected -- is taking its place in the geographical pattern of two continents. It is more than a highway for tourists, more than an avenue of commerce; it is destined to...
docs.lead_paragraph: SLOWLY but surely the Pan-American Highway -- perhaps the greatest road ever projected -- is taking its place in the geographical pattern of two continents. It is more than a highway for tourists, more than an avenue of commerce; it is destined to knit together the social and political fabric of many nations and to help realize the dream of Pan American solidarity.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 -- In a demonstration of willingness to share existing stocks of critical materials with Latin-American nations, the Supply Priorities and Allocations Board put earmarks today on 218,600 metric tons of tin plate for export to those...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 -- In a demonstration of willingness to share existing stocks of critical materials with Latin-American nations, the Supply Priorities and Allocations Board put earmarks today on 218,600 metric tons of tin plate for export to those countries in the twelve months beginning Dec. 15.
docs.abstract: Defense: SPAB allocates stocks for export to Latin Amer

headline.main: U.S. ALLOCATES TIN TO LATIN-AMERICA; SPAB Earmarks 218,600 Tons as Part of Equal Sharing With Hemisphere Nations OTHER PRODUCTS ON LIST Similar Orders Likely to Follow on Farm Equipment, Steel, Rayon, Tanning Materials

byline.original: By CHARLES E. EGANSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 -- A total of 189 additions were made through the State Department tonight to the blacklist of nationals having Axis ties in Latin America. The effeet is to withhold the benefits of American trade by forbidding American firms,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 -- A total of 189 additions were made through the State Department tonight to the blacklist of nationals having Axis ties in Latin America. The effeet is to withhold the benefits of American trade by forbidding American firms, under penalty of fines, from dealing with companies and individuals having dealings with Axis interests.
docs.abstract: Trade blacklist: additions, deletions and revisions

headline.main: 189 MORE NAMES PUT ON BLACKLIST; State Department Reads Out Persons and Firms With Axis Ties in Latin America TRADE WITH THEM BARRED Ten Deletions Are Made From Earlier Lists-Revisions Also Are Announced
